page.title: 07Piddinghoe Notes
page.content:
Eighteen different species of birds have been sighted near the pond during 1985. This is the first year that the Canada Geese have nested on the pond. They have raised three goslings. With the increase of wind-surfing and sailing it is wondered if they will return next year and raise another brood or whether they will be scared away.
~~~~~~~~~~~
A street lamp has been erected by the local residents in the approach road to the village hall as a memorial to the late Nelson Caplin (a resident of Piddinghoe) who ran the Post office. The lamp was lit for the first time during August 1985.
